comments.text: Google should not be indexing bugzilla.mozilla.org
comments.raw_text: Google should not be indexing bugzilla.mozilla.org
comments.creator: nelson@bolyard.me
comments.author: nelson@bolyard.me
nelson@bolyard.me
comments.creator: nelson@bolyard.me
comments.text:
There's nothing random about the way NSS selects an issuer cert from among 
multiple certs with the same subject name.  This is working as it was 
designed to work, and has been working for ~15 years.  It will continue to 
work that way until Mozilla switches Firefox to use libPKIX for all cert chain building and validation.  

I agree with Kai and Wan-Teh. The solution is for the affected site to stop sending out a cert that is not (yet) trusted.
comments.raw_text:
There's nothing random about the way NSS selects an issuer cert from among 
multiple certs with the same subject name.  This is working as it was 
designed to work, and has been working for ~15 years.  It will continue to 
work that way until Mozilla switches Firefox to use libPKIX for all cert chain building and validation.  

I agree with Kai and Wan-Teh. The solution is for the affected site to stop sending out a cert that is not (yet) trusted.
